channel.title: Nhat Duy's Blog
channel.description: Recent content on Nhat Duy's Blog

item.title: The best real estate I ever received
item.description: 1. Notes Real estate is all about wasting time. The more time you waste, the more money you can take. (p. 4) Always develop on the area growth is comming. If you are a little early, the growth will bail you out. If you develop on an area that the growth is already done or it not continuing, if you are wrong, you are wrong forever. (p. 18) Auction helps both seller and buyer.

item.title: Một đời quản trị
item.description: 1. Notes Mỗi khi nhân viên than thiếu người, Phan Văn Trường chọn cách cắt giảm nhân sự. Vì ông tin rằng, team đông người quá mức cần thiết cho nên dẫn tới việc thiếu đoàn kết, nên làm việc kém hiệu quả, công việc bị đình trệ. Khi nhân sự cắt giảm đi thì team gắn bó hơn, mọi người tranh nhau làm việc. Người lớn với trẻ con cũng ko khác nhau là mấy, chỉ khác nhau ở việc dấu giếm, che đậy bản chất tính cách của mình.

item.title: Tứ thư lãnh đạo
item.description: 1. Notes Những thứ tác động nhanh ko nguy hiểm, tác động từ từ mới nguy hiểm. Câu chuyện chú ếch và hiệu ứng cá da trơn. (p. 139) Không dành nhiều thời gian để dự đoán tương lai, vì như vậy dễ làm bỏ lỡ thời cơ đưa ra quyết sách. Chuyên gia kinh tế học cũng có những dự đoán sai lệch. Phải giữ uy tín. Phải biết nắm bắt cơ hội.

item.title: Deep understand about Core Data
item.description: 1. Introduction Core Data provides on-disk persistence, which means your data will be accessible even after terminating your app or shutting down your device. This is different from in-memory persistence, which will only save your data as long as your app is in memory, either in the foreground or in the background. Xcode comes with a powerful Data Model editor, which you can use to create your managed object model.

item.title: How to talk to anyone
item.description: 1. Notes How to win friends and influence people is old one, for 21st century, we need new techneque. Smile slowly, the way we smile is very important. Big winners have 50 vocabularies more than others, try to use as many as vocabulary as possible Try to get quoted from books, internet, use them when you get in the talk show. Never ever make a joke at anyone elses expense.

item.title: Google Firebase: Push notification in iOS
item.description: 1. Introduction Push Notifications is a loud and powerful way for our apps to engage with our users. We engage with our users by letting them see values with their very owns eyes. Users see values. Users engage. We can engage our users by letting them know about something important. Perhaps their favorite sport team is about to compete. A flash sale on watermelons is on for 30 minutes. Or there is an important meet up in the desert later this weekend.

item.title: Apple keys and certificates
item.description: 1. Apple Development This file is used to added to Xcode, then developer can run app on device. 1. Mobile provision keys (.mobileprovision file) It is created from Apple Developer Center. Go to Profiles -> Select plus button -> Select iOS App Development (Create a provisioning profile…) -> Select App ID which created from a -> In Select Certificate and Select Devices, select all -> Download .mobileprovision file 2. Certificate Signing Request (.

item.title: Create a custom view in iOS: Everything needs to know
item.description: 1. Introduction In iOS programming, we usually need to create custom views. We create them not only for reused, in some cases it also help us move a lot of code to other class. In this article, I will share you guys everything we need to know when we create a custom view. What is difference between when we create with nib file and without it. OK, let go…

item.title: Concurrency in iOS part 4 - Three problems
item.description: This article is final part of serial concurrency tutorial, if you have not read part 1, part 2 and part 3, I recommend you read them first. In this article, I will show you 3 problems that you must pay attention when you use concurrency. Those are race conditions, deadlock and priority inversion. Let’s go… 1. Race conditions Example you have two threads executing, they are both trying to modify an object’s count variable.

item.title: Concurrency in iOS part 3 - GCD and NSOperation
item.description: This article is part 3 of serial concurrency tutorial, if you have not read part 1 and part 2, I recommend you read them first. In this article, I will show you GCD and NSOperation. Advantages and disadvantages of them. Common… 1. Grand Central Dispatch (GCD) GCD is lowest level to support run the tasks concurrently. It is easy for impletation. Basically, we use GCD in most cases. There are 3 kinds of queue in GCD.

item.title: Concurrency in iOS part 2 - Serial and concurrent queue
item.description: This article is part 2 of serial concurrency tutorial, if you have not read part 1, I recommend you read it first. In this article, I will show you serial queue and concurrent queue. However, before we move on to them, we also need to know about synchronous and asynchronous. 1. Synchronous and asynchronous The tasks may either perform synchronous or asynchronous. When the task is running as synchronous, your app will wait and lock current run loop until the task finishes.

item.title: Concurrency in iOS part 1 - Introduction to CPU, process and thread
item.description: Before we learn deeply about concurrency in iOS, I will briefly show you the basic related knowledge. That are CPU, process and thread. 1. What is the CPU used in iPhone? Apple used many different CPU for their phone. Example: iPhone 6, 6S used dual core iPhone 7, 7S used 4-core iphone 8, 8S used 6-core iPhone XS, XS Max, XR used 8-core 2. What is process? To meet the demand running many applications at the same time.
